website_summaries.verdict: A hands-on kit that teaches kids about magnetism and magnetic fields. They can even build their own electromagnet.
pros: Instructions to make invisible magnetic field, electromagnet, compass, contained shavings, and more
cons: The horseshoe magnet must be handled with care

customer_reviews.title: Neat, but iffy quality.
customer_reviews.text: I like the pieces, this is a well thought out kit. The horseshoe magnet broke in half within minutes, with a less than a foot drop from my son's hand to the table. That was really disappointing. Comparing it to other kits, I'd still choose this one, most don't have the metal filings, but still pretty bummed that it didn't even go 5 minutes without breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really wouldn't recommend this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really wouldn't recommend this purchase. We have used other Thames & Kosmos sets (physics is awesome!), but this one is lacking. Our magnet broke the moment we got the kit, it was so brittle. The compass is useless, except to show that it reacts to magnets, which I suppose is it's purpose. As a homeschooling family I found the booklet to be lacking lots of information and did not meet my expectations for what projects we could do. You can easily create a similar kit with better products that will last a lot longer and are more fascinating.
customer_reviews.author: MT Mama to 6

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a half-afternoon
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad set of magnets, but I feel like it was overpriced for what it is. My kids played with it for a few hours when they first opened it, and were briefly fascinated by the levitating donut magnets, and I think they liked the clear plastic container of iron filings the most, especially experimenting with the different shapes formed by the files based on the shape of the magnet. But I think for the price, it could have included a few more accessories besides the magnets themselves to sustain interest.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew who loves hands on activities, learning and science. This is a super cool gift and a great price, I would definitely suggest this for any child who likes to take things apart, put them back together and experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Horseshoe magnet and bar magnet small.
customer_reviews.text: I teach preschool science to 2-5 year olds. I used this kit recently for a lesson on magnets. This was a great kit to let kids explore the property of magnets. It gets only 4 stars because the bar magnet and horse shoe magnet, which are the only magnets which show th he magnetc poles, are tiny and hard to see. Otherwise a terrific kit!
customer_reviews.author: Genia

customer_reviews.title: Magnet is easily breakable
customer_reviews.text: I would like to let this company know that I bought this set for my classroom and we finally got to learning about magnets and the horseshoe magnet is broken. Not very good product when the magnet breaks the first time you open the box and use it to teach magnets to students. Unacceptable and wish this company could do something about that.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what the kit contains
customer_reviews.text: Many reviews mention receiving damaged magnets but none of the magnets I received were broken. The kit contains a variety of magnets which is nice. But the instruction booklet is lacking. There are only a few interesting experiments in the beginning of the book, like maybe 5 of them. The rest of the the activities involve messing with the little, cheap compass that comes with the kit, and my son was having none of that so this kit is just sitting on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: ButterflyRose

customer_reviews.title: My nephew really loved this.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew, he loved it, I will be looking at this line toys in the future for more gift ideas. This was a pretty nice set for the price, parts seem to be good quality and it came with a really nice set of experiments to do if you are so inclined. Thumbs up to Thames & Kosmos for making these types of toys that kids can enjoy and even learn from.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good value and good teaching tool, but 1 piece came broken.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little set to teach kids about magnetism. My son played with it for a few minutes on Christmas after opening it before getting distracted by another new toy. He was very curious about the compass, so it was a good opportunity to teach him how it works. Unfortunately the horseshoe magnet came broken in the box, so I had to super-glue it back together. Will have to spend more time with it and do some of the experiments.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Not What it Appears on Box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these Magnets for my classroom because I thought they would be so much fun for my Preschool Classroom. Well they came in today and I am VERY disappointed. They are so small that my children will not be allowed to play with them. And then to see how small they are and the price I just paid, I am very upset! I will be gifting to an older classroom that can use them!!! Just always make sure you read the box very carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Will Jones

customer_reviews.title: He loved it. Bought another one for a friends son ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson when he was visiting. He loved it. Bought another one for a friends son for who turned 8 for his birthday he loved it ,had to get one or my granddaughter for when she comes. I know she will love it to. Seems to be a great gift for 3rd graders.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Overprocedt
customer_reviews.text: For $50 I thought there would be more. They made it seem bigger with all the packaging. My son was done playing with it in an hour. Storage may have been meant to be in the original packaging, but things fell out of place anyway.
customer_reviews.author: My Life With Reiki

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for 9 year old Boy!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift for a 8 year old boy. His mom says that he put dune his device & played the entire afternoon with it. They had just finished a magnet unit at school. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fuminater

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: It was fun until one of my kids broke some of the magnets after a few uses... Otherwise they enjoyed playing with it a lot and it was educational.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for science lovers!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome magnetic science set. My son loves playing with it. Lots of neat items to learn and play with. There are lots of small pieces so be carful with younger children.
customer_reviews.author: emmanuel arechiga

customer_reviews.title: Broken on Arrival but Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for my 6 year old to share a science experiment with her class. Like other people mentioned, the horseshoe magnet was broken upon arrival and it's super small and a pretty weak magnet. She did however love the magnet rings and magnetic balls so she mainly used them. The book has some nice information. Overall, my daughter liked it and it wasn't too expensive but I hate receiving broken items.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken on delivery and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Horseshoe magnet broken in 3 pieces when my daughter opened the box for Christmas. Poor quality and waste of money.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooperative play with siblings
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to a friend's daughter for her 5th birthday. They tell me both their kids (ages 4 and 5) love it and play with it together often. The parents like that it doesn't require an adult to handle every single step to make it fun.

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic Science Kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband, who has always had a love for magnets. Even as a grown man, he got quite a kick out of the different bits in this kit. He has been doing some of the experiments with our six year old and that has worked wonderfully too. The booklet that comes with it has tons of experiments and ideas that are really ideal for when you're wanting to teach kids about magnets. I highly recommend this kit! Do keep in mind that for the most part, all of the bits are small and on the weak end magnet wise. Comes with the territory of such a kit though. They still work great!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit.

One horse shoe broke when a kid dropped it when it didn't instantly stick to a fridge, but that can happen. Lots of learning potential in this little box! I'd say go for it! Your kids will have a blast!

Anyway, I haven't even looked through it but I opened it up for my 8 year old daughter and 4 year old son to look through it. They "played" with it for two hours. My daughter did about 3 experiments listed in the book on her own accord. I look forward to other experiments.

product_meta.title: Thames & Kosmos Magnetic Science | 33 STEM Experiments | Ages 8+ | Learn About Earth’s Magnetic Poles | Discover How Invisible Magnetic Fields Work | Full-Color 48-Page Manual
product_meta.description:
Explore the invisible and amazing power of magnets with 33 engaging experiments and games. This science experiment kit contains many magnets of different shapes and sizes, and a variety of other components with which you can explore this classic scientific subject. Experiment to determine which materials are magnetic and which are not. Learn about magnetic poles and magnetic fields. Discover how Earth behaves like one giant magnet, and how we use compasses to take advantage of this phenomenon to determine which way is north. Conduct a series of experiments to learn first hand how magnets behave and interact under different conditions. Make invisible magnetic fields visible using iron filings in an enclosed transparent box. Build an electromagnet to learn how electricity relates to magnetism. Finally, have some fun with what you have learned by playing some games with magnets. The full-color, 48-page manual guides your experiments with illustrated step-by-step instructions.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Explore the invisible and amazing power of magnets with 33 engaging experiments and games. This science experiment kit contains many magnets of different shapes and sizes, and a variety of other components with which you can explore this classic scientific subject. Experiment to determine which materials are magnetic and which are not. Learn about magnetic poles and magnetic fields. Discover how Earth behaves like one giant magnet, and how we use compasses to take advantage of this phenomenon to determine which way is north. Conduct a series of experiments to learn first hand how magnets behave and interact under different conditions. Make invisible magnetic fields visible using iron filings in an enclosed transparent box. Build an electromagnet to learn how electricity relates to magnetism. Finally, have some fun with what you have learned by playing some games with magnets. The full-color, 48-page manual guides your experiments with illustrated step-by-step instructions.
feature_bullets: Experiment with magnets of all shapes and shizes
